body: Good afternoon Victoria. Ask Grants hosted a June Workshop for the FY2016 FOA template. The materials can be found at the HRSA Share Point page https://sharepoint.hrsa.gov/ofam/dgp/AskGrants/AskGrants.aspx

Hi, Arlene -  She should look at the OPM website for additional information on determining if it is a legitimate email or not.  The CSID emails should come from opmcio@csid.com, and their number is 844-777-2743.  

OPM lists all of the precautions that should be taken and recommends reporting phishing emails to the Anti-Phishing Working Group at https://apwg.org/report-phishing/.  They collect and publish info on known phishing schemes.     

In the meantime, she should also check her credit reports at www.AnnualCreditReport.com if she hasn't done so already.    

I hope everything works out for her!

Jacqueline, thank you for the extra information and I'll pass it around since this of course affects all Feds @@.

Arlene@SAMHSA, appreciating you!

Do you think $18* a pay period is too much?

* - average
I am proud of my 25 years of service here at FDA.

TDWI has an easy-read companion 5-pager to the below post, on "Visual Dashboards for Self-Service BI". I found the final recommendation struck a chord with me: "Evolve your BI capabilities to move beyond simple monitoring and analysis to advanced analytics that can predict the future and reveal the hidden patterns in your data". Yep, that's the next step. The data is already there, the cost of collection has been sunk, why not exponentially increase our ROI by exploiting it to the full? Alas, for many of us, the assemble-clean-and-display stage gobbles up our time and energy and pretty soon we are into the next cycle and have to do it all over again without as much focus on predictions and patterns as we would have liked. Anyone got some tips on how to get past this hump consistently? Meanwhile, you can download their free doc from here:  http://searchdatamanagement.bitpipe.com/data/demandEngage.action?resId=1429715287_638

NTEU's National President, Colleen Kelley, wrote to the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) requesting an immediate briefing and employee notification plan following OPM’s latest announcement of a larger, more serious, employee data breach potentially compromising background investigation materials.

At this time, OPM has not announced a notification plan stemming from the June 12th announcement of a massive breach affecting background investigation records.  NTEU is aware that email and mailed letter notifications are in the process of going out from CSID, the OPM-selected contractor providing credit monitoring and identity theft protection services, for the June 4th OPM announcement. 

Given the large amount of remaining unknown information—as to who exactly has been hacked, and what exact information has been compromised, Colleen's letter to OPM Director Katherine Archuleta asks for an immediate briefing, as well as providing a series of recommendations that NTEU believes would assist federal employees and their family members at this time. See Colleen's letter attached.

NTEU is aware that we are rightly upset and outraged over these breaches. We deserve to have your personal information protected by federal agencies.

I will keep you updated on this situation going forward.
http://fedsavvy.com/  I just listened to a webinar about TSP.  Very good.

Another great TED Talk. This one focuses on building high achieving teams thru social cohesion. Margaret Heffernan's ideas align with our Leadership competencies. For me, it demonstrates the value of investing time and resources into people, which are our strongest assets.

FICO, an analytics software company, is hosting a webinar on 6/24 showcasing best practice examples of organizations that have combined all the D2D threads (e.g. analytics, process management, customer insight, modeling, monitoring, and refining) to promote faster and better decision-making. In my education, it was always two spaces after a period; one space after everything else; colons, semi-colons, and commas.

I was taught two after periods and colons, one after everything else. When I had to switch to AP Stylebook, it was one after periods and I never thought to look at colons. The AP doesn't specifically say, but it looks like it should only be one space after a colon.
